description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows OLE remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38152), the following update packages should be applied across supported Windows versions:

1. Download and install the relevant KB updates based on your operating system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
   - For Windows 10 (x64): [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit): [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)

**Details**:
- This update resolves a heap-based buffer overflow issue that could allow remote code execution if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability. 
- Ensure that your system is running an applicable build of Windows 10 or 11.

**Preconditions**:
- User must have administrative privileges to perform the update installation.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
